did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, manuscripts, music scores, photographs, programs, clippings, printed material.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Professional papers include correspondence pertaining to his professorship and librarianship at Cornell and as a visiting professor elsewhere. Personal papers include correspondence with friends and family in Germany.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Professor of Music (1923-1927) and University Librarian (1930-1946), Cornell University.

chronitem.event: Organist and Choirmaster, Episcopal Chapel of the Incarnation, New York City
Student, University of Berlin and Royal Academic Institute for Church Music in Berlin
Research, Germany; Cataloging and describing the musical scores and books on music in the libraries of the central German states
Ph.D. thesis: "Orgel und Klavier in der Music des 16. Jahrhunderts"
Instructor in organ amd music theory at University of Breslau
Librarian of the Royal Academic Institute for Church Music
Lecturer in Music History in the Faculty of Philosophy (Breslau)
New York Public Library - Head of Division of Music
Cornell University - Chairman, Department of Music; University Organist, Sage Chapel Choir Director
Cornell University Librarian and Professor of Musicology

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Professional papers include correspondence pertaining to his professorship and librarianship at Cornell and as a visiting professor elsewhere (1946-1958); organizations include the American Council of Learned Societies, the American Musicological Society, and the Music Library Association; correspondents include Carl Becker, Stephen Vincent Benet, Morris Bishop, Lane Cooper, Walter Damrosch, Albert Einstein, Stephen A. McCarthy, William Sulzer, Oliver Strunk, Walter Toscanini, and Paul J. Weaver. Personal papers include correspondence with friends and family in Germany, especially after World War II when he aided many with Care packages; also, unpublished manuscripts, music scores, photographs, concert programs, clippings, and other printed material.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Otto Kinkeldey papers, #14-20-1000. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

label.emph: Series I. Personal Papers, 1922-1966, preserved in original order, include family correspondence, buisness papers, photographs, post cards

Series II. Alphabetical Files, 1924-1966, arranged alphabetically and chronologically by correspondent, organization, or subject, include correspondence, music manuscripts, programs, buisness papers, biographies, recommendations, photographs, war posters, post cards, newsclippings. Note - Hans Erdmann and Erdmann Guckle are the same person - filed under Erdmann
Series III. Subject Files, 1922-1965, include correspondence, programs, lists, newsclippings, bibliographies related to work and organizations, arranged alphabetically and chronologically

defitem.label: Subseries A. American Academy of Arts and Sciences, 1942-1962, includes correspondence, programs, announcements, pamphlets, reports re AAAS, arranged chronologically
Subseries B. American Council of Learned Societies, 1926-1940, includes correpondence, minutes, agenda, announcements, re ACLS, arranged chronologically
Subseries C. American Music Society, 1955, includes correspondence, bills, lists, papers, music re AMS, arranged chronologoically
Subseries D. Berkeley, correspondence during 1954-1955, includes correspondence, small watercolor, minutes, bills, proof, print, arranged alphabetically, chronologoically
Subseries E. Columbia University Press, 1932-1952, includes correspondence, newsclippings, telegrams, re Musicology Committee and advice on publications, arranged chronologoically
Subseries F. Denton, 1951-1952, correspondence while at Denton, Texas, includes programs, reports, recommendation, arranged alphabetically, chronologoically
Subseries G. German Papers (legal size folder), 1901-1910, include job recommendations, letters (copies), contracts, papers, certificates re Music Society, arranged chronologoically
Subseries H. Harvard Summer, 1936-1941, includes correspondence, reports, constitution, list, announcements, postcards, arranged alphabetically, chronologoically
Subseries I. Harvard, 1947-1948, includes correspondence, instructions re teaching at Harvard summer session, arranged alphabetically, chronologoically

Subseries J. Harvard, 1962, 1931-1962, includes correspondence, telegrams, roll sheets and grades, newsclippings re teaching at Harvard, and publications by Harvard University Press, arranged chronologoically
Subseries K. Music Libraries Association, 1931-1965, includes correspondence, rules, lists, minutes, bulletins, by-laws, excerpts, cataloging code, drafts re MLA
Subseries L. National Music Council; 1941-1944, 1950, includes correspondence, by-laws, reports, bulletins
Subseries M. New York Public Library, 1963, includes correspondence, reports, acknowledgments
Subseries N. Society for Ethnomusicology, 1955-1956, includes correspondence, programs, minutes, certificates of incorporation
Subseries O. Texas I, 1948-1949, includes correspondence, announcements, minutes, programs, bulletins, article, newsclippings, invitations, review, telegrams
Subseries P. Texas II, 1949-1950, includes correspondence, minutes, bulletins, programs, bills, outlines, lists, postcards, newsclippings, telegrams, arranged alphabetically, chronologoically
Subseries Q. Urbana, correspondence during 1953-1954, includes correspondence, papers, contents, report, list notes, statement, arranged alphabetically, chronologoically

label.emph: Series V. Lecture notes, correspondence, bibliographic notes, pamphlets, programs, certificates, newsclippings; 1901-1926, 1953
Series VI. Miscellaneous materials and material from a file; pamphlets, music scores (ms., engraved and printed), programs, correspondence, patent, lecture notes

did.unittitle: Includes Harris Townsend Medal for Notable Achievement, CCNY, 1940 ; autographed picture (copy) of Lane Cooper; framed portrait (unidenified); snapshots (unidenified); photos of Kinkeldey; photo album; ceremonial ribbon; guest book to the Kinkeldeys, from their friends in Ithaca, NY, 1946-1953 ; banquet program/menus
